work.p: It is possible that lines in this manuscript represent an early draft of lines from the poem that was eventually titled "Salut au Monde!," first published as "Poem of Salutation" in the 1856 edition of Leaves of Grass. In the poem, Whitman writes "I see where druids walk'd the groves of Mona ... / I see Christ eating the bread of his last supper in the midst of youths and old persons," (1891, p. 115–116).

notesStmt.note: It is possible that this manuscript is an early draft of lines from the poem that was eventually titled "Salut au Monde!," first published as "Poem of Salutation" in the 1856 edition of Leaves of Grass. The apparent connection to "Poem of Salutation" makes the likely date of composition before 1856. This manuscript is pasted down, making the verso inaccessible.
